  8.  def context[R]: EnvBio[R, Nothing, R]

    Returns current context, embedded in EnvBio.

    Returns current context, embedded in EnvBio. Example:

    import scala.concurrent.duration.Duration
import tofu.env.bio.EnvBio

val env: EnvBio[String, Nothing, String] =
  for {
    _   <- EnvBio.unit
    ctx <- EnvBio.context
  } yield ctx

env.run("ctx").runSyncUnsafe(Duration.Inf)
// will result in Right("ctx")
    Definition Classes
    EnvBioFunctions
  9.  def delay[A](x: => A): EnvBio[Any, Throwable, A]

    Creates EnvBio from total effect.

    Creates EnvBio from total effect. Any Throwable raised by x will result in failed EnvBio fixed to Left side.

    Definition Classes
    EnvBioFunctions
  10.  def delayTotal[A](x: => A): EnvBio[Any, Nothing, A]

    Creates EnvBio from total, non-throwing effect, resulting in a value of type A.

    Creates EnvBio from total, non-throwing effect, resulting in a value of type A. Any Throwable raised by x will result in fatal error being thrown.

  13.  def fromTask[A](task: Task[A]): EnvBio[Any, Throwable, A]

    Creates EnvBio from Task.

    Creates EnvBio from Task. Any Throwable raised by Task will result in failed EnvBio, fixed to Left side.

    Definition Classes

  14.  def fromTaskEither[E, A](task: Task[Either[E, A]]): EnvBio[Any, E, A]
    Definition Classes
    EnvBioFunctions
  15.  def fromTaskTotal[A](task: Task[A]): EnvBio[Any, Nothing, A]

    Creates EnvBio from total, non-failing Task.

    Creates EnvBio from total, non-failing Task. Any Throwable raised by Task will result in fatal error being thrown. Example:

    import monix.eval.Task
import monix.execution.Scheduler.Implicits.global
import tofu.env.bio.EnvBio
import scala.concurrent.duration.Duration

val env: EnvBio[Any, Nothing, Unit] = EnvBio.fromTaskTotal(Task.delay(1))
val res = env.run(()).runSyncUnsafe(Duration.Inf)

// res = Right(1)
    Definition Classes
    EnvBioFunctions

  27.  def raiseError[E](e: E): EnvBio[Any, E, Nothing]

    Returns EnvBio that on execution is resulting in specified domain error being returned as Left Example:

    Returns EnvBio that on execution is resulting in specified domain error being returned as Left Example:

    import monix.execution.Scheduler.Implicits.global

val env: EnvBio[Any, String, Nothing] = EnvBio.raiseError("error")
val result: Either[String, Nothing]   = env.run(()).runSyncUnsafe(Duration.Inf)
// result is Left("err")
    Definition Classes
    EnvBioFunctions
  28.  def shift(ec: ExecutionContext): EnvBio[Any, Nothing, Unit]

    Introduces an asynchronous boundary, effectfully shifting execution to another thread or call stack.

    Introduces an asynchronous boundary, effectfully shifting execution to another thread or call stack. This implementation differs in that underlying Monix Task will be executed on injected Scheduler. An implementaion delegates to Monix's implementation (see monix.eval.Task.shift)

    Definition Classes
    EnvBioFunctions
  29.  def shift: EnvBio[Any, Nothing, Unit]

    Introduces an asynchronous boundary, effectfully shifting execution to another thread or call stack.

    Introduces an asynchronous boundary, effectfully shifting execution to another thread or call stack. An implementaion delegates to Monix's implementation (see monix.eval.Task.shift)

    Definition Classes
    EnvBioFunctions
  30.  def sleep(duration: FiniteDuration): EnvBio[Any, Nothing, Unit]

    Creates a new EnvBio that will sleep for given duration, and then continue execution.

    Creates a new EnvBio that will sleep for given duration, and then continue execution. This operation doesn't block a thread, the blocking is semantic.

    duration

    duration for 'sleeping', after which a tick will be emitted and execution will go on

    Definition Classes
